title: Mouse/Cursor Issues

embed.description: Clip of Arcarim Playing League of Legends - Clipped by kareb_

body:
My friend has been having a lot of issues with his mouse/cursor lately.

As you can see in the clip above, his cursor is "stuttering" or maybe, it's frame skipping as he tries to move it. 

I've been trying to help find a solution to fix this but I've found nothing thus far, I was hoping someone on here could help.

We have tried the following:
- Changing all mouse-related settings to copy mine
- Reinstalling his mouse drivers
- Updating all drivers for everything
- Changing USB ports
- Closing all applications & making sure no application is behind his client while he plays

replies.body:
Looking at the video, it looks like it's not his mouse that's stuttering but his whole frame-rate. Cover up the left half of the screen where his cursor is and just watch his champ and you can see the stutter. Obviously it's most noticeable on the cursor since that's generally what we're most aware of, and less obvious on his champ because it's moving in a predictable and smooth, and much slower fashion where the cursor does not.

If this is a recent issue, I would look at doing things like a clean re-install of the game (via the Hextech Repair Tool), and cleaning out space on his hard drive. A too-full hard drive, especially on HDDs can cause problems that could well manifest in this manner.

Failing that, I'd submit a ticket to player support and they can help him further: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new

Depending on how old/low-spec his PC is, and given that it occurred here in a team-fight and levelled out after that, it could be a case of his actual hardware not keeping up too.

If it was a frame-rate issue wouldn't everything be stuttering and not just himself? At least to me, it seems more like stream lag more than anything that you're referring to but I will suggest the clean reinstall and computer space clean up.
Yes, it appears that everything is stuttering, it's just most noticeable on cursor and character because they have the most intricate movement (and thus it's easier to tell when frames are jumping).
